summary:
The Security Council:
 
Reaffirms all previous resolutions on Western Sahara, particularly 1108 (1997), 1292 (2000), 1301 (2000), 1309 (2000), 1324 (2000), and 1308 (2000).
 Recalls principles from the Convention on the Safety of UN and Associated Personnel.
 Welcomes the Secretary-General's report (S/2001/148) and supports the Personal Envoy's role.
 Supports MINURSO's efforts to implement the Settlement Plan for a free, fair, and impartial referendum.
 Notes remaining fundamental differences between parties on the Settlement Plan.

1. Extends MINURSO's mandate until 30 April 2001, expecting parties to work towards a mutually acceptable solution under the Personal Envoy's auspices.

2. Requests the Secretary-General to assess the situation before the mandate ends.

3. Decides to remain seized of the matter.
